shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: BREAKING: Pa. Health Department OKs Tenor Health acquisition application for 3 NEPA hospitals
shorts.description: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content_distilled: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.

shorts.title: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa. Department of Health review
shorts.title_distilled: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa.
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content_distilled: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

shorts.title: HS ROUNDUP: Scranton’s Jacklinski scores 1,000th point
shorts.title_distilled: HS ROUNDUP: Scranton’s Jacklinski scores 1,000th point.
shorts.description: Chrissy Jacklinski scored 27 points, including the 1,000th of her career, to lead No. 6 Scranton to a 61-26 victory over West Scranton on Monday night at Lackawanna College Student Union. Jacklinski had 973 points entering the game, and reached the milestone in the third quarter. Jaelyn Alers added 13 points for the Lady Knights (8-11, 5-6), while Jahiya Parker added seven points. Sahmira Menifee led the Lady Invaders (3-15, 0-10) with eight points. Boys wrestling Gabe Caufield (172 pounds), Jake Rafferty (189), Tyler Gallo (215) and Rocco Emilio (285) each had a pin to lead Wallenpaupack to a 53-15 […]
shorts.content: Chrissy Jacklinski scored 27 points, including the 1,000th of her career, to lead No. 6 Scranton to a 61-26 victory over West Scranton on Monday night at Lackawanna College Student Union. Jacklinski had 973 points entering the game, and reached the milestone in the third quarter. Jaelyn Alers added 13 points for the Lady Knights (8-11, 5-6), while Jahiya Parker added seven points. Sahmira Menifee led the Lady Invaders (3-15, 0-10) with eight points. shorts.title: Clipboard, February 3, 2026
shorts.description: Ledgedale Chicken barbecue: Ledgedale Volunteer Fire Company chicken barbecue, Feb. 14, 1 p.m.-sold out, fire hall, 529 Goose Pond Road, eat in or takeout available. Mayfield Pierogi sale: St. John’s Russian Orthodox Cathedral homemade (deep fried only) pierogi sale, Ash Wednesday, Feb. 18, 11 a.m.-sold out, St. John’s Center, Hill Street; $12/dozen, no orders, first come, first served. For information, call the rectory at 570-876-0730, Mott at 570-335-2128 or Sandy at 570-876-3576. Old Forge Garbage stickers: The price of a garbage sticker will now be $3. The new stickers are now available in stores. Blue stickers will still be accepted […]

shorts.title: PIAA WRESTLING: Abington Heights, Honesdale set for openers
shorts.title_distilled: PIAA WRESTLING: Abington Heights, Honesdale set for openers.
shorts.description: For the first time in four years, Abington Heights captured a District 2 Class 3A wrestling duals title. Meanwhile, Honesdale stayed atop District 2 Class 2A for the fourth straight season. Now, the District 2 squads will host their PIAA first-round matches Tuesday, with the Comets wrestling at Scranton High School because of the Pink Night girls basketball game at Abington Heights, and the Hornets getting another home match. Abington Heights (15-4) will face the winner of the preliminary match between District 11 runner-up Bethlehem Catholic (11-2) and District 1 fourth-placer Owen J. Roberts (11-7). That match is scheduled for […]
shorts.content: For the first time in four years, Abington Heights captured a District 2 Class 3A wrestling duals title. Meanwhile, Honesdale stayed atop District 2 Class 2A for the fourth straight season. Now, the District 2 squads will host their PIAA first-round matches Tuesday, with the Comets wrestling at Scranton High School because of the Pink Night girls basketball game at Abington Heights, and the Hornets getting another home match. Abington Heights (15-4) will face the winner of the preliminary match between District 11 runner-up Bethlehem Catholic (11-2) and District 1 fourth-placer Owen J. Roberts (11-7). That match is scheduled for […]
shorts.content_distilled: For the first time in four years, Abington Heights captured a District 2 Class 3A wrestling duals title.

shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Lackawanna League division races head down the stretch
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Lackawanna League division races head down the stretch.
shorts.description: It is hard to believe that February is here and there are just two weeks left in the Lackawanna League girls basketball regular season. That means the division races are heading down the stretch and teams are looking to secure the best possible seed for the District 2 playoffs. This week could go a long way to determining both. In Division I, North Pocono, Abington Heights and Scranton Prep are all 8-2 and Valley View is 7-3. On Tuesday, North Pocono visits Abington Heights in the annual Pink Game and Valley View travels to Scranton Prep. Then Friday, Scranton Prep […]
shorts.content: It is hard to believe that February is here and there are just two weeks left in the Lackawanna League girls basketball regular season. That means the division races are heading down the stretch and teams are looking to secure the best possible seed for the District 2 playoffs. This week could go a long way to determining both. In Division I, North Pocono, Abington Heights and Scranton Prep are all 8-2 and Valley View is 7-3. On Tuesday, North Pocono visits Abington Heights in the annual Pink Game and Valley View travels to Scranton Prep. Then Friday, Scranton Prep […]
